intro: Pavetta bowkeri var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and covered with fine, soft hairs. The hairy pavetta is often found in moist, shaded areas within forest understories.
